item.description:
Report X-2023082030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found at 100 belt. Upon discovery I immediately placed the package in a double lined hazmat bin. DescribePack: A bottle cap was loose, a small amount of liquid leaked from bottle, liquid leaked onto package and made a hole in that area. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a double lined hazmat bin

item.title: Report X-2023081626
item.description:
Report X-2023081626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver found box leaking on delivery truck and placed inside several plastic bags to bring back to the station for inspection. DescribePack: 4 1gal bottles of HypoCleanse Isopropyl Alcohol 99% Tech Grade in box with no Hazmat or Limited Quantity markings. Bottles separated into 2 each on either side of a single cardboard divider. Cap on 1 bottle was misaligned and spilled 80% of the liquid into the box. SDS says Class 3 PG II but box only had printed directional arrows and no Hazmat service. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver placed box inside several plastic bags and gave to QA for inspection when he returned to the station

item.description:
Report X-2023080931

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of Formical-4 fixative decalcifier are crushed and leaked from loose caps. Only slotted partitions were used as inner packing materials. The bottles have a seal but the caps were not secured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin, upon arrival, for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report E-2023081030
item.description:
Report E-2023081030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 28, 2023, at 0909 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Miami, Florida regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons combined of Tremco PUMA BC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), Tremco PUMA TC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), VULKEMÂ® 171 Primer (UN1133, Adhesive, 3, II) from (an unknown amount of) 6-gallon metal drums. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor, the underside of the truck, and a small area of the asphalt under the trailer. All waste generated was containerized in (1) roll-off by contractors which was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090049
item.description:
Report E-2023090049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: MILTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1188 was mishandled by terminal personnel and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC personnel utilized absorbent pads to collect the released product, then transferred the remaining product into one (1) new 55-gallon drum for further shipping. Utilizing hand tools, all UN1188 impacted material was containerized in one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080348
item.description:
Report X-2023080348

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKER. HAZMAT WAS FOUND SITTING OUTSIDE AN OUTBOUND BAY. THERE WAS A SMALL SPILL OUTSIDE OF THE BOX. SPILL AND HAZMAT WERE PROPERLY CLEANED BY RESPONDER AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
